The transfer path describes how the vibration is transferred from the source component to the responding component. This path can include any physical element that touches or is connected both to the source component and the responding component, or can include sympathetic vibration, where the vibration is transferred via sound waves.

Transfer paths can involve more than one component and area of a vehicle. For example, a fluctuation in the engine can be transferred through the exhaust system and cause the exhaust system to vibrate.

Feature:
Anti-dive system

Customer Benefit:
Safety

Positioning:
The Gold Wing's anti-dive system uses brake fluid pressure generated by the LBS system to minimize front fork dive when braking. This application of anti-dive and LBS produces enhanced stability when manoeuvring at both low and high speeds.

page.instructions:
Can you remember which of these vehicles compete in the same market as the Honda Fit? Choose the vehicles that are competitive with the Honda Fit and drag them into the correct column below.

Click and drag each item under the appropriate heading.
page.feedback: The Accent, Versa, Yaris and Wave are some of the main competitors in the subcompact segment. All these vehicles are similarly positioned to be versatile and economical, but the Fit does each of these better while adding a little fun to the mix.

page.instructions:
Here is a video comparing some of the performance features and specifications of the TSX and A4 with the TSX's advantages highlighted. After you view the video, turn your attention to the hotspots, which will provide an overview of three main performance features that help create these advantages.

Move your mouse over each feature to find out more.

hotspot.hotspotText:
Feature
The TSX's 205 hp, normally-aspirated 2.4L i-VTEC engine is one of the best 4-cylinder engines in production. i-VTEC technology gives this engine superb versatility by providing great low-end torque for quick and useful off-the line acceleration. In higher rpm ranges, this engine switches cam profiles to enable the TSX to produce its 205 hp at a head-spinning 7000 rpm. By not using a turbocharger in its engine, the TSX will be void of the turbo lag that plagues the A4 2.0T.

Benefits
The combination of great low-end torque and high-end power enables a brisk 0-60 mph acceleration time and produces an exhilarating ride all the way to the engine's redline, without the turbo lag of the A4's engine.

Benefits
With one of the smoothest shifting, close-ratio manual transmissions around, a TSX driver can easily maintain direct and precise control, keeping the car in its optimum power range.

Feature
Larger diameter and lightweight alloy wheels promote better handling and driving dynamics by resisting body roll. This is due to the fact that the wheel is stiffer than the tire and will be less malleable when force is pushed upon them during a turn.

Benefits
With larger diameter standard wheels than its competition, customers will experience better handling and cornering ability in a TSX than an A4 equipped with 16 inch wheels.

page.instructions:
Match each of the comfort, safety and technology benefits below with the feature that provides it.

Drag and drop the images from the bottom of the screen to the best location at the top of the screen. Click the checkmark to see the correct answer.
page.feedback: To help remember, try breaking the features down into comfort, safety and technology categories.
page.feedback2: Not quite. To help remember, try breaking the features down into comfort, safety and technology categories.
page.drop1: Keeps the bike stable and in control while braking
page.drop2: Provides clear sound is available at all speeds
page.drop3: Provides rider with maps and verbal directions
page.drop4: Enhances stability when manoeuvring at both low and high speeds
page.drop5: Provides optimum rider and passenger comfort

page.feedback:
Here's what I would say:
With maps pre-loaded for virtually all of North America, you will never have to carry maps again. Plus, because the system accepts voice commands and provides directions audibly, you can safely use the system while riding.

page.instructions:
Match the benefits on the left with their respective active or passive safety feature on the right.

Click and drag from a red circle on the left to the corresponding target on the right.
page.feedback: Now that you know about the safety features and benefits, Mr. and Mrs. Ramnarine have a few questions for you.

drag.dragtext: Enhances stability while cornering by preventing under/oversteer
Prevents airbag injuries by controlling the deployment rate
Increases balance and steering control under braking

page.content: Let's take a closer look at the Gold Wing's Honda Satellite-Linked Navigation System.

page.feedback: Let's move on and see if you can answer Mr. and Mrs. Ramnarine's question about the CR-V's passive safety features.

choice.choicetext: Acts like a full time AWD system
Safer because it is an automatic system
Better traction in all weather conditions
Slows torque transfer to prevent wheelspin
